questions.question_text: Which of the following provides redundancy on a file server to ensure the server is still connected to a LAN even in the event of a port failure on a switch?

discussion.content:
NIC teaming is the process of combining multiple network cards for
performance and redundancy (fault tolerance) reasons. This can also be
called bonding, balancing, or aggregation
Can someone explain the key words that make this NIC teaming and not load balancer?

comments.content: NIC teaming offers better load balancing and increased fault tolerance.

discussion.content:
If you MADE it so far, WELL DONE!
You can NAIL the exam.
Good luck.

comments.content: This time I agree with switch as it says "Which of the following devices must be configured in the new building?" all of the others can be preconfigured.. I think its a matter of semantics again...

discussion.content:
This end of this prep has really gone out with a whimper rather than a Bang.

These last 80 questions or so are very suspect. Answer given here is B) Switch.
I see the answer given elsewhere is C) Modem.

I am not sure either one is correct.
There are 40 new questions as of 8/19/21, to still study.

questions.question_text: A network technician needs to install network devices in a new building. The building will be a part of the corporate network and has the connection to the core network already. Which of the following devices must be configured in the new building?

discussion.content: IMO rj-45 is not a tool but an accessory
why D and not F are rj 45 connectors tools

comments.content: 66 blocks are still used for phones, but 110 blocks are being phased out with patchpanels
Not F because punchdown tools are used for connecting wires to 66 and 110 blocks. Punchdown tools are not used to connect between two devices.

questions.question_text: A network technician receives a spool of Cat 6a cable and is asked to build several cables for a new set of Ethernet runs between devices. Which of the following tools are MOST likely needed to complete the task? (Choose three.)

A network administrator is investigating an issue with VoIP calls that are not establishing properly. After troubleshooting, the administrator is able to determine the
SIP responses are not being received by the gateway. Which of the following did the administrator use to determine this information?

comments.content: thank you for your response, makes sense now
C is incorrect because tracert finds where a packet stopped on the network, but you can't specify the type of packet, such as a SIP packet.

discussion.content: I think that the correct answer is C. tracert

comments.content: never mind, i think the given answer is correct by reading the second time.
why ? I thought you were right..

discussion.content: A packet analyzer, are you kidding me man ? This has to be tracert right ?

comments.content: "Reuse as much of the existing infrastructure as possible", and you want to buy a whole ass converter?

discussion.content: Media Converter would do the job
Going through the 900+ questions I came to conclude that GBIC uses SC, SFP uses LC, and the patch panel uses ST.

questions.question_text: A network technician is planning to upgrade an end-of-life network switch and wants to reuse as much of the existing infrastructure as possible. The end-of-life switch uses a GBIC, but the new switch will use an SFP. Which of the following will the network technician MOST likely need to perform before completing the upgrade?

choices.B: Reterminate the fiber with SC connectors.
choices.A: Reterminate the fiber with ST connectors.
choices.D: Reroute the fiber through a media converter.
choices.C: Reterminate the fiber with LC connectors.
